Summary Proficient in Microsoft Suite, Extensive Sales and Marketing background, Strong project management and time management skills, Calm under extreme pressure and demanding conditions. Experience Brand Specialist/Buyer Amazon August 2015  – Present (1 month) Greater Seattle Area Amazon Fashion - Buyer for Pearls, Crystal, CZ, & Glass Associate Vendor Manager Amazon October 2014  –  August 2015  (11 months) Seattle, WA Amazon Fashion - Wedding & Engagement, Gemstone, Pearls, & Diamonds Sr. Financial Analyst Intel Corporation November 2013  –  September 2014  (11 months) Hillsboro, OR •	As Division Revenue Analyst: responsible for supporting and forecasting ~$251M/89Mu in annual revenue/volume across Intel’s Thunderbolt and Ethernet products, P&L consolidations (cost, inventory, spending, etc.), and reporting. 
•	Generated 160 hrs/year in time savings by creating the P&L Margin Model that tracks changes in operating margin cycle over cycle due to changes in volume, ASP, cost, inventory, and spending. Changes are outputted into an easily readable waterfall diagram and aids in variance analysis. 
•	Drove improvements in revenue reporting processes by developing and automating an efficient financial close model. 
•	Created methodology to track Thunderbolt OEM and Device Vendor volume by target segments, providing insight into future trends by highlighting customer, segment, and product transitions. Used data to influence the focus of marketing efforts on key customers and trending accounts. Regularly present findings to Marketing mgmt team and GM. 
•	Quantified demand and revenue trends in order to influence business decisions, analyzed sales trends in various geographies, and developed and reported quarterly revenue and volume forecasts on a weekly basis.  
•	Maintaining and enhancing Wireless Division (Wifi & WiGig product lines) long-term financial model, long range planning P&L project manager. 
•	Received Divisional Recognition Awards for work on P&L Margin Model and Thunderbolt Segment tracker. Financial Planning & Analysis Analyst Intel Corporation September 2012  –  November 2013  (1 year 3 months) Hillsboro, OR •	Managed budget of ~$155M and ~800 employees for various corporate finance & accounting groups across 5+ geographies. Identified trends, performed variance analysis, Ad-hoc requests, and presented results. Assisted groups to achieve 100% of budget spending compared to previous year’s 115%. 
•	Saved ~500 hrs. /year & earned a divisional recognition award by driving various process improvements by building financial models in the areas of monthly/quarter close, yearly/quarterly financial planning cycles, and consolidations. Aided in training and transferring many of these processes to the shared service center in Costa Rica. 
•	Partnered with the Treasury Finance organization to influence and improve their budgeting, enabling them to end the year at 99% of budget, a significant improvement over 110% of budget the previous year. 
•	During the yearly financial planning cycle, provided budget cut recommendations which drove over $600K in savings and influenced uncontrollable budget reductions of $2.3M (8%), driving significant improvement in forecast accuracy. 
•	Spearheaded redesign of FP&A training and resources website. Served as content creator and project manager. Venture Partner University of Washington Foster School of Business Executive Education January 2012  –  March 2012  (3 months) Greater Seattle Area •	Analyzed potential W Fund Businesses 
•	Evaluated proposals 
•	Met with CEOs and executive teams to discuss business strategies 
•	Wrote recommendations based on due diligence and valuation of companies District Manager College Works Painting September 2010  –  September 2011  (1 year 1 month) Greater Seattle Area •	Organized and conducted on-campus recruiting at Bellevue College and UW 
•	Provided extensive one-on-one supervision on a daily basis to managers 
•	Motivated and trained in sales, marketing, and technical skills 
•	Conducted weekly evaluations and handled terminations Branch Manager College Works Painting November 2009  –  September 2010  (11 months) Greater Seattle Area •	Finished #1 in the state of WA with over $101k in sales ($20k above #2) 
•	Finished #16 in the Nation for sales and Top 3 Nationwide in telemarketing 
•	Washington State Manager of the year 2010 
•	Part of 98% growth year 
•	Selected for an intern position with one of the top 100 internship programs for selectivity as ranked by The Princeton Review: Internship Bible. 
•	Utilized aggressive, personal strategies to establish a client base in the Western Washington community 
•	Devised solutions and negotiated resolutions to ensure client satisfaction

Experience Internal Auditor Intel Corporation March 2013  – Present (2 years 6 months) Santa Clara, CA 
• Conducted financial and operational audits to determine reliability and effectiveness of control systems 
• Analyzed accounting records, statistical data, organizational procedures, and operational records 
• Evaluated effectiveness and efficiency of key business processes across various Intel functions for risk 
• Reported and presented findings and recommendations to senior management 
• Influenced change based on analysis of audit findings in the business 
• Analyzed and synthesized data quickly in audit testing by employing strong finance technical skills 
• Awarded the Internal Audit Excellence Award for providing outstanding client service 
• Awarded Outstanding SOX Testing for executing testing efficiently for 7 of 8 high profile revenue controls 
 Americas Sales and Marketing Revenue Finance Lead Intel Corporation April 2011  – Present (4 years 5 months) Folsom, CA • Forecasted and reported the Americas Region Revenue of approximately 50% of all Intel Revenue 
• Identified opportunities to streamline the revenue process through partnering with multiple finance, operations and global revenue teams 
• Developed forecasts for the weekly, quarterly, and annual revenue 
• Led the quarterly revenue close process and finalized revenue reporting in compliance with external reporting guidelines 
• Recognized with a Best In Class Award for ranking first among other regions for revenue close execution 
 Senior Financial Planning & Analysis Analyst Intel Corporation April 2006  –  April 2011  (5 years 1 month) Folsom, CA • Supported the business by closing the books and analyzing variances and trends for a $200M annual expense, $9M capital budget, 900 headcount group 
• Developed financial forecasts consistent with the business objectives of the organization 
• Ensured compliance with reporting standards, corporate policies and integrity of internal/external reporting 
• Provided financial support to senior management including the department head and operational managers 
• Earned a Division Recognition Award for the successful implementation of control processes to protect Intel’s intellectual property and high value inventory.

Experience Financial Planning and Analysis Analyst Intel Corporation June 2014  –  August 2015  (1 year 3 months) Swindon, United Kingdom • Provide financial support to business groups to enable the business, whilst adhering to appropriate controls 
• Monitor the headcount and spends of group within my division, report these numbers to business partners, understand and explain variances to group consolidators, and influence the groups on how to spend most effectively. 
• Serve as the key contact point for discretionary related queries by management team and other analysts 
• Review current processes to highlight potential efficiencies and recommend changes in order to meet the department’s time saving target 
• Extensive use of Microstrategy, Business Objects, and Excel to display, format and manipulate data in order to produce value-adding reports to assist in the development of indicator packages and reporting templates 
• Produce monthly/quarterly reports and conduct trend analysis to identify areas where savings can be achieved 
• Use problem-solving skills to solve discrepancies/ anomalies within reports
